{"step_by_step_thinking": "The qSOFA score is a quick Sequential Organ Failure Assessment score used to identify patients with sepsis who are at high risk of poor outcomes. According to Document [28], the three criteria for the qSOFA score include a respiratory rate greater than or equal to 22 breaths per minute, systolic blood pressure 100 mmHg or less and altered mental status. Therefore, unequally dilated pupils is not a component of the qSOFA score.", "answer_choice": "D"}
